author: admin_l6ma5gus
title: This strategy attacks unapproachable metastatic breast cancer
text:
Triple negative breast cancer (TNBC) remains the most aggressive and deadly type of breast cancer. 15 percent of breast cancer cases are triple negative. Its prognosis is poor since the disease is highly resistant to existing treatments because its cells, unlike hormonal tumors, lack the receptors targeted by breast cancer drugs.
How to attack cells that become resistant to treatments is urgently needed to control this type of cancer.
One of the innovative strategies is the one proposed by a team from Brigham and Women’s Hospital (USA) in a study published in ‘ Nature ‘.
Using patient-derived samples in preclinical work, researchers discovered that combining two therapeutic agents could push the cells of this deadly tumor to a more treatable state.
“When combined, these therapeutic agents can hijack signals that occur naturally in the body to eliminate breast cells after breastfeeding cessation, thereby killing these aggressive cancer cells,” says lead author Karen Cichowski. “Our results provide compelling support for the development of clinical trials to test whether the combination of these agents could benefit patients with triple-negative breast cancer.”
Specifically, the researchers discovered that by combining two types of agents, known as EZH2 and AKT inhibitors, they could induce metastatic breast cancer cells to differentiate.
Once the cells differentiate, These agents kill tumor cells by triggering a process similar to involution. which typically occurs when breast tissue returns to a non-lactating state after the mother stops producing breast milk.
The researchers also used machine learning to predict patient responses, another step that could help pave the way for clinical trials in patients.
In future studies, this team is interested in exploring whether similar drug combinations may be effective in other tumor types.
#strategy #attacks #unapproachable #metastatic #breast #cancer

author: Brooke Anderson ــ Washington, DC
title: Minnesota Muslims on edge after hit and run outside mosque
text: A hit and run car collision on a pedestrian in front of a mosque in Minnesota has left the local Muslim community shaken after an escalation in attacks on their places of worship in recent years. The incident, which appeared to be intentional, took place midday on Wednesday outside the Alhikma Islamic Center in Minneapolis. Osman Ahmed, director of advocacy for the Minnesota chapter of the Council on America-Islamic Relations (CAIR), was standing in the parking lot of the mosque, where he had been helping them apply for a security grant. A driver then accelerated into him, throwing him into the air and then quickly fleeing the scene, video footage shows. Ahmed sustained serious, but not life-threatening, injuries. The suspect, identified as James Evan Suttles, was soon arrested. He was charged with second-degree assault for using a car as a dangerous weapon to intentionally hit a person. He was found to have been harassing this same mosque since it first opened in 2020. "I think the biggest thing for us to figure out is how to get to the bottom of this issue," Jaylani Hussein, executive director of CAIR-Minnesota, told The New Arab. "This is having a big impact on our community, and it's definitely creating a sense of fear." He added that he is also concerned about rehabilitation of the driver, who is believed to be mentally ill. "When you have hate combined with mental illness, you don't want the person to just suffer in prison. We want the best outcome possible, if that means this person needs to go to a treatment centre rather than prison," he said. Minnesota, home to the largest Somali community in the US, leads the country in mosque attacks , with 22 incidents occurring in the past three years, including the first half of 2024. Moreover, since the outbreak of Israel's war in Gaza, there has been a sharp increase in anti-Muslim incidents across the US. It is believed that a major factor for Minnesota's high rate of mosque attacks is the national profile of US Representative Ilhan Omar, who has become a key target for the far right, often by individuals or groups from out of state.

author: world today news
title: Austrian Canaanite Catholic Community Celebrates Christmas with Special Guests from Spain and Switzerland - World Today News
text: Vienna ∙ The Austrian Canaanite Catholic Community (AKCC) celebrated Holy Mass and Christmas at the Hirschstetten Church. From Spain Fr. Saju Mulakat, Fr. Jijo Mathew joined Ilavungachal and offered Holy Communion. Under the leadership of Elizabeth Coithara, the devotion of the Choir, including Brother Robin, intensified. After Holy Mass, celebrations were held in the Parish Hall. The 2022–2023 AKCC committee members, the St. Kuriakos team’s teamwork and church-community fervor, graced the occasion. As the spiritual director of the Austrian Knanaya community, Fr. Abraham Kuruttuparampil shared with the audience the letter of Archbishop Mar Mathew Mulakat officially appointing Jijo Ilavungkachal. Warming the pearl, AKCC Liturgy Coordinator Stephen Koramatham, Fr. Jijo was greeted with applause by everyone. President Abraham Kurutuparmil welcomed the ex-members who came from Switzerland and [Germany](https://www.world-today-news.com/tag/germany/) to participate in the celebrations of AKCC. With carols, tap music, and sweet Christmas Santa, Stephen led the audience to a Christmas experience on the east side. Jesin Mannaruparail, Nidiya Edappalliirail and TG Koithara led the artistic programs for children and young [women](https://www.world-today-news.com/tag/women/). 2023 college/school graduates and young [women](https://www.world-today-news.com/tag/women/) who after higher studies are proudly working in different places in Europe, AKCC honored and gave benefits to them. Piya Kannampatam moderated. Secretary Nadina Puthanpura thanked everyone. The newly appointed St. Thomas team will be in charge of the Canaanite community for the next year at the conference which concluded with a feast of love. English Summary: Austrian Knanaya Catholic Community Celebrated Christmas #Austrian #Canaanite #Catholic #community #contemplated #Christmas 2023-12-29 10:33:50

author: Belga Belga
title: France: Mayotte en alerte rouge cyclonique à partir de vendredi soir
text:
France: Mayotte en alerte rouge cyclonique à partir de vendredi soir
L'archipel français de Mayotte sera placé en alerte rouge cyclonique vendredi à 22H00 (20H00 à Paris) en raison du passage du cyclone Chido, a annoncé le préfet de ce département français dans l'océan Indien.
[Belga](/journaliste/belga-5fd9b0a1d8ad5844d1b9592e/)Agence
- Publié le 13-12-2024 à 15h24
- à Mamoudzou, France
"C'est un événement inédit, d'une extrême violence, les vents pourront dépasser 180 km/h", a expliqué François-Xavier Bieuville lors d'une conférence de presse. Le préfet a appelé les personnes logées dans des habitations précaires, très nombreuses dans le département le plus pauvre de France, à se confiner dans les centres d'hébergement ouverts par les autorités.
Ces centres, situés dans les établissements scolaires et gymnases, "seront ouverts à tous", a-t-il assuré.

author: La Gaceta
title: El consenso regirá la agenda del Pacto tucumano, afirmó Jaldo
text: El gobernador, [Osvaldo Jaldo](https://www.lagaceta.com.ar/tags/1679/osvaldo-jaldo), reafirmó la convocatoria a la oposición a firmar una suerte de “ [Pacto de Mayo a la tucumana](https://www.lagaceta.com.ar/nota/1042588/politica/pacto-mayo-tucumana-respuesta-opositores-convocatoria-jaldo.html)”, y advirtió que los plazos y los asuntos a tratar también estarán sujetos a lo que se discuta entre los representantes de los partidos políticos. Además, advirtió los temas escogidos -como la reforma electoral y el acceso a la información pública- deberían ser tratados mediante proyectos de ley por la Legislatura provincial. “Si las medidas son por decreto administrativo, mañana viene otro gobernador y con otro decreto lo cambia; (pero) si se hace por ley, le da una seguridad y una garantía jurídica”, explicó el mandatario. Jaldo había formulado esta convocatoria en los actos del 9 de Julio, tras la firma del Pacto de Mayo promovido por el presidente, Javier Milei (La Libertad Avanza), que contó con la adhesión de 18 gobernadores. A partir de ello, referentes del radicalismo, del alfarismo, del bussismo y del armado libertario, entre otros, coincidieron al ser consultados por LA GACETA en que había buena voluntad para el diálogo de su parte. A su vez, algunos de los opositores advirtieron que, antes de rubricar un acuerdo local, deberían consensuarse los temas a discutir, y propusieron desde una reforma impositiva hasta una revisión del régimen electoral. Ayer, en conferencia de prensa, Jaldo instó a los representantes de todos los partidos políticos de la provincia a firmar ese acuerdo de gobernabilidad. Además, puso énfasis en la necesidad de una postura institucional similar a la mantenida entre la Provincia y la Casa Rosada desde el inicio de su mandato. “Conjuntamente con los poderes que me acompañan, hemos tenido una actitud de apoyo y acompañamiento con Nación desde el primer día que asumimos, porque somos conscientes de que la patria es una sola y de que teníamos la obligación y la necesidad de acompañar a quien le toca dirigir los destinos de la Argentina, sea del partido político que sea. Porque fue elegido por la voluntad mayoritaria de los argentinos y porque tenemos una responsabilidad institucional de trabajar juntos”, indicó. E instó a los diferentes partidos políticos de la provincia que tienen roles institucionales con representación legislativa en la provincia a tener la misma actitud y proceder en consecuencia. El mandatario recordó además el compromiso asumido en junio del año pasado, firmado junto a monseñor Carlos Sánchez en el Arzobispado de Tucumán. Y remarcó que cada espacio político tiene el documento firmado en el Arzobispado. “La Iglesia se tomó el trabajo y la gran responsabilidad de comprometer a los candidatos de ese momento”, dijo. Y remarcó que “son 10 puntos muy parecidos a lo que se ha firmado con Nación, y que tiene que ver con cuidar y proteger la democracia, con la lucha contra la pobreza y la exclusión, con la generación de puestos de trabajo dignos, con la ética y la transparencia de las cosas públicas, con fortalecer una educación inclusiva e integral, tiene que ver la prevención de adicciones y lucha contra el narcotráfico, la inseguridad, promover y trabajar en el cuidado del ambiente, cambios del sistema electoral y austeridad en la gestión del Estado”. Según afirmó Jaldo, varios puntos ya fueron abordados durante esta gestión. “Este Gobierno es uno de los impulsores de tener un gobierno plural, participativo, y esto es una muestra concreta de cuidar la democracia. En mi gabinete hay funcionarios que son de otros espacios políticos. Esa es una muestra clara de consolidar la democracia”, afirmó. Jaldo consideró que era clave que se firme el Pacto de Mayo a nivel nacional para poder avanza con estos acuerdos a nivel local, en cada provincia. “Si me preguntan los tiempos, cuanto antes lo hagamos, mucho mejor. Pero no depende exclusivamente de este gobernador; si es un acuerdo, son varias las partes que intervienen. Por lo tanto, entre las partes que intervienen vamos a fijar no solo el contenido, sino también los plazos en la firma de este acuerdo”, expresó. Además, consideró que deberían ser puestos en vigencia mediante leyes, “que son el instrumento que permite la sustentabilidad en el tiempo a las decisiones que se tomen”. “Son temas como la modificación del sistema electoral, el acceso a la información pública, temas que tienen que salir por ley. Los plazos, lo antes posible, siempre y cuando lleguemos a un consenso lo antes posible”, reiteró Jaldo.

author: Hello!
title: The secret to choosing a snow-sure ski resort this winter
text:
The Telegraph The secret to choosing a snow-sure ski resort this winter Read full article Lucy Aspden 29 December 2023 at 6:00 pm · 5-min read Dreaming of a white ski season? Don't rely on luck alone - THIBAUT LOUBERE/OT Val Thorens
Nobody wants to go on a ski holiday without any snow. Not only is the white stuff a key aesthetic to the perfect winter wonderland, it’s imperative to actually being able to spend your days on the slopes skiing or snowboarding.
Last winter, holiday spirits were dampened when mild temperatures and rain forced some low-lying resorts to temporarily shut down operations on the pistes. By contrast, this winter’s ski season in Europe has started with bumper snowfall in many resorts – however the risk of high temperatures can always be cause for concern. All is a reminder of the effects changing weather patterns are having on the future of ski holidays .
Travellers’ behaviour reflects just how important good snow cover is to a happy holiday. According to research carried out by the Mountain Trade Network (MTN), resort altitude (and the associated guarantee of snow) is the third most important factor for Britons when booking a ski holiday (marginally behind ski area size, and price). It’s importance has skyrocketed in the past three years, according to historic MTN data.
Luckily, it’s something the ski industry has been preparing for. British-run VIP Ski no longer offers packages to resorts lower than 1,500m – to ensure its customers will have ski-to-the-door conditions – while the likes of Crystal Ski Holidays, Inghams and Club Med now have policies that guarantee against poor snow cover and closed slopes. The latter, in its most recent customer survey, found 81 per cent of people would be more likely to book a holiday with an operator offering a snow guarantee. Under these terms and conditions customers are offered the chance to move their plans to an alternative (open) resort, to ensure they can ski, or to cancel and claim credit towards a later departure.
Now, more than ever before, it pays to know how to choose a ski resort where snow is almost always guaranteed , whatever the season throws at us.
Five tips for finding a snow-sure resort Aim high Heading high is one of the single most important factors for guaranteed snow conditions. Every 1,000m you ascend equates to an estimated drop in temperature of 9.8°C if clear and 6°C if cloudy; every metre higher means you are that much further above the freezing level – the point where rain (one of the worst words in a skiers’ lexicon) turns to snow (one of the most positive). Be warned, experts are warning, as ski resorts battle the impacts of climate change, that the freezing level will continue to rise in altitude.
Story continues The French resort of Val Thorens is the loftiest village in Europe (2,300m) with access to some of its highest slopes, up to 3,230m. It’s one of the best bankers for snow but any resort with slopes up to 3,000m is a good bet.
Val Thorens is the highest resort in Europe, where snow is guaranteed almost all season - OT Val Thorens Glacial good luck Glaciers go hand in hand with high-altitude resorts. These gigantic blocks of ice, which can be over 100m deep, are excellent at preserving snow once fallen, and when mostly scraped off are still useful for perfecting skiing-on-ice skills.
The highest glacier skiing in Europe, the Plateau Rosa at 3,500m, accessed from Zermatt in Switzerland and Cervinia in Italy, offers 21km of prepared pistes. Other notable resorts with glaciers include Solden and Hintertux in Austria, Saas-Fee in Switzerland, and Tignes and Les Deux Alpes in France. The super-keen can be found honing their skills on training courses hosted on the most snow-sure glaciers during the summer and autumn months, if snow levels allow, and their snow-sure qualities make them enduringly popular in winter too.
North face, happy face We all know the benefits of a south-facing garden as it gets more sunshine and the same principle holds true for a ski resort’s pistes. Lovely though it is to bask on sun-drenched slopes, it’s not good for snow quality – unless it’s toe-curlingly cold and then it really doesn’t matter. Since north-facing slopes aren’t affected by the sun, conditions remain much more consistent and the snow remains in better nick for longer, especially late in the season. The problem is, most piste maps rarely reveal the orientation of the slopes – you need a proper chart to assess accurately.
Location, location, location Some destination have lucked out with benign weather systems. Japanese resorts, especially those on the north island of Hokkaido, are a good example. They are not high, don’t have glaciers and are not overly endowed with north-facing slopes. What they do have is geographical good fortune.
Japan is blessed by incredible natural snow fall Wind blows from Siberia, hits the Sea of Japan then dumps up to 15m a year of the lightest, fluffiest snow known to humankind. The Utah resorts of Alta and Snowbird have a similar annual snowfall, thanks to a similar effect. Most of Utah’s storm systems come from the Pacific ocean but local geography has an impact too. The Great Salt Lake, north west of the city, warms the approaching air and aids moisture. The warm air rises, cools and starts to drop its snow - a phenomenon known as Lake-effect snow. Resorts in North America could be among those that benefit from the El Niño winter – with predictions of record-breaking snow levels.
Faking it Snow-making has come on in leaps and bounds over the last 20 years and many resorts have invested millions in the latest technology, which is both reliable and sustainable. Resorts in the Italian Dolomites are a great example where almost all of its 1,200km of pistes are covered by snow cannons, if the real stuff comes up short. So long as it’s cold enough, there will be snow.

author: Anonym
title: The opposition will not vote on Milei's omnibus law as it stands: what are the changes they are asking for - The Limited Times
text:
Still shocked by the broad content of the omnibus law that Javier Milei sent to Congress, the blocs of Deputies are dedicated to the study of the issues but they advance something: so, as it came they are not going to vote for it . The delegation of legislative powers to the Executive, the elimination of the retirement formula and the increase in withholdings are among the issues that generate the most rejection . In addition, they will call for changes on key issues, such as the authorization to take on debt and privatizations.
The discussion process is already generating tensions . La Libertad Avanza intends that it will only be discussed in a plenary of four commissions (Constitutional Affairs, General Legislation, Budget and Foreign Relations), but the opposition will ask for more involvement.
They have already sent the recommendation to the president of the Chamber, Martín Menem , who is ultimately the one who will end up deciding.
"The reality is that it should go to no less than 20 committees because of the number of issues involved, but if you do that, the debate never ends. But it's also true that you can't discuss education and health reform without including those commissions. Or amend the penal code without including the Justice and Criminal Affairs commission," said a key member of the radical bloc.
From the UCR – a party that sought and continues to offer options to the ruling party to accompany the mega DNU – they are in full study, but they advance some issues that they already consider "invokable ".
Among them, the delegation of legislative powers - in economic, financial, fiscal, social, social security, security, defense, tariff, energy, health and social matters - to the Executive for two years, but with the possibility of extending it until 2027, that is, throughout Milei's government.
"
The UCR has always opposed superpowers and delegating powers from Congress to the Executive . You can't legislate blindly, each proposal must guarantee improvements for retirees, workers and/or businessmen and defend minorities who should have representation in Congress," said the vice president of the radical bloc, Karina Banfi.
Radical Senator Maximiliano Abad expressed himself in the same vein. "What cannot happen, because it is not republican and puts any decision at risk, is that one of the branches absorbs powers from the others or even tries to supplant them," he said.
This issue is echoed by the rest of the opposition benches. The brand new bloc chaired by Miguel Angel Picheto, which joined with the Civic Coalition and the Cordovans of Juan Schiaretti, now has 23 legislators and will be key to the quorum. The delegation of powers put them on alert.
"The president was elected to improve our lives, not to build an empire," Margarita Stolbizer, a member of that caucus, said harshly.
The President entertains himself with minor matters or seeks to entertain us. It doesn't set priorities and it doesn't tell us how it will solve the main problem of the economy that crosses everyone's life: inflation. He was chosen to improve our lives, not to build an empire.
— Margarita Stolbizer (@Stolbizer) December 28, 2023
The suspension of the pension formula is another point that makes noise. The legislators who were previously grouped in Juntos por el Cambio remember that this is what Alberto Fernández wanted to do and that they voted against it.
"The Executive's Omnibus Law project, copied from Alberto Fernández's in the 2019 emergency law, proposes the suspension of the retirement mobility formula. Enough of adjusting pensioners, Mr. President. Set pensions in UVAs, so that the elderly don't lose more," said Martín Tetaz.
The issue of withholdings is another issue that garners massive rejections. Milei himself campaigned promising to lower taxes, and when his Minister of Economy, Luis Caputo, announced that they planned to sustain and increase them, several governors – especially from the provinces of Entre Ríos, Córdoba, Buenos Aires and Santa Fe – said they were against it.
Although the ruling party assures that it will be transitory, the law stipulates that the power of the Executive to lower it is transitory. "If you don't, they will be permanent," they warn. The Executive's bill proposes to increase to 33% for soybeans and derivatives and 15% for wheat, corn, sunflower and the entire industry.
In the PRO they are still moderate. The law was divided into thematic groups to be studied and next week the bloc will meet to establish a position. "With all the desire to accompany and support the government," they say close to Cristian Ritondo's leadership. Although the caucus coexists with legislators who raise objections, it is still low.
